root: ^(Garry isn’t one to skimp on expenses.)
^(He’s always happy to throw his wealth around if it means he can show off.)
^Multiple exotic plants, a mahogony table, and a garish ice sculpture of the host himself as a centerpiece for the table.)
^(One of Garry’s staff follows behind me with a silver tray holding six ornate crystal glasses filled with wine.
^(As I move to grab one of the glasses, a straight laced-looking man grabs it before me.)
^(Looks like the people here are as charming as Garry. I grab a glass and place it at the seat that isn’t taken.)
^(The only one impressed by the display is Garry and the woman with strange glasses.)
^The rest of the partygoers have an attitude more suited for a funeral.)
^(I clear my throat, eventually Garry tearing his gaze away from his cold counterpart to notice me.)
^Mr. Greener! Welcome! The most important piece of the game reveals himself!
^I’m so excited for whatever you have planned, Mr. Faust!
^It means the party can finally start! Go on, meet, mix, mingle.
^When you’re ready to start the game grab your glass and we’ll have a toast.
^(Guess we’re doing this again. At least Garry’s games are entertaining.)
